comment._content: Samuel Untermyer testified before the same Federal Commission on Industrial Relations as Ida Tarbell (neighboring photo). He appeared on Jan 18, the day before her. See NYT of 1/19/1915 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=F40A11FF3E5C13738... "URGES FEDERAL REIN ON BIG FOUNDATIONS; Untermyer Also Condemns Wall St. Control of Industries at Commission's Inquiry. "

comment.author: 76016463@N00
comment._content: The Walsh Commission, (Commission on Industrial Relations) was "created by the U.S. Congress on August 23, 1912. The commission studied work conditions throughout the industrial United States between 1913 and 1915. The final report of the Commission, published in eleven volumes in 1916, contain tens of thousands of pages of testimony from a wide range of witnesses" en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Commission_on_Industrial_Relations The 1916 report is available online and contains the testimony of Untermyer and the others pictured in the Bain Collection. Interesting primary source material on the views of Labor and the captains of industry in an age before most of the present-day legal controls over workplace conditions were in place. www.archive.org/stream/industrialrelati08unitrich#page/74...
